intro: Hypericum montbretii, commonly known as the creeping St. John's wort, is a low-growing shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to August. The plant has opposite, linear leaves and produces red or orange fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
